hospitalization.department: Department of hospital where patient was hospitalized

patient medical history.physiological context: Relevant physiological history of the patient
patient medical history.psychological context: Relevant psychological history of the patient
patient medical history.vaccination history: History of vaccinations received by the patient
patient medical history.recent surgeries: Details about any recent surgeries undergone by the patient
patient medical history.allergies: Any known allergies of the patient
patient medical history.sexual history: Relevant details about patient's sexual history
patient medical history.drug usage: Information about any drugs used by patient

symptoms.name of symptom: Specific symptom experienced by the patient
symptoms.intensity of symptom: Severity or intensity of the symptom
symptoms.when did the symptom appear: Time of onset for the symptom
symptoms.temporalisation: Any specific timing patterns associated with the symptom
symptoms.behaviours affecting the symptom: Activities or actions that influence the symptom's severity or occurrence.

treatments.name: Treatment prescribed to the patient
treatments.dosage: Amount or strength of the treatment
treatments.frequency: How often the treatment is taken
treatments.duration: The length of time the patient should take the treatment
treatments.reason for taking: The medical reason for taking the treatment
treatments.reaction to treatment: Patient's reaction or response to the prescribed treatment

medications.name of medication: Medications currently being taken by the patient
medications.dosage: Amount or strength of the medication
medications.frequency: How often the medication is taken
medications.duration: The length of time the patient has been taking the medication
medications.reason for taking: The medical reason for taking each medication

discharge.follow up: Details about any follow up appointments
